description: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint.  These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver final presentation.
descriptionMD: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint.  These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver final presentation.
name: PowerPoint 2016
subtitle: Presentation application to create slide shows

episodes.description: This course will cover everything you need to create a presentation in PowerPoint. These episodes start at the very beginning by exploring the PowerPoint environment, how to add slides to a presentation, insert text and images into slides, create tables and charts, apply design themes, enhance with animation, and prepare to deliver final presentation.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.300
>> [SOUND]
>> Hello.

2
00:00:04.300 --> 00:00:08.020
>> We've got an exiting new show
coming your way, at ItProTV.

3
00:00:08.020 --> 00:00:08.910
PowerPoint 2016.

4
00:00:08.910 --> 00:00:12.350
Here to tell us all about it,
is Ms Vonne Smith.

5
00:00:12.350 --> 00:00:13.020
>> Thanks, Mike.

6
00:00:13.020 --> 00:00:16.150
Yes, we're going to be starting in
PowerPoint from the very beginning.

7
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:19.900
We're go through our environment and be
able to identify things like the ribbon,

8
00:00:19.900 --> 00:00:24.620
and the status bar, and the title bar to
get us familiar with our environment to be

9
00:00:24.620 --> 00:00:29.330
comfortable adding in those informations
that we want in our slides.

10
00:00:29.330 --> 00:00:32.660
We will be adding slides, and
we'll be changing our layouts for

11
00:00:32.660 --> 00:00:36.690
our slides to be able to have a layout
of what we want to be able to do,

12
00:00:36.690 --> 00:00:42.750
whether it's adding text, or do we want to
compare different items and add headings?

13
00:00:42.750 --> 00:00:46.060
Maybe we wanted to add some images in
there and just have a blank slide layout.

14
00:00:46.060 --> 00:00:48.770
So we'll be going over all
of those different options.

15
00:00:48.770 --> 00:00:54.200
We will be adding text, images,
charts, tables, smart art.

16
00:00:54.200 --> 00:00:57.270
And then, we're going to be
formatting all of those elements

17
00:00:57.270 --> 00:01:01.030
with nice design themes to make
everything look pleasing to the eye.

18
00:01:02.060 --> 00:01:03.570
We will be adding animations,

19
00:01:03.570 --> 00:01:06.130
we'll also be adding some slide
transitions to be able to give us

20
00:01:06.130 --> 00:01:10.290
a little extra pizzazz when we're going
to be delivering our presentation.

21
00:01:10.290 --> 00:01:13.510
This series expects that you do not
really know anything about PowerPoint to

22
00:01:13.510 --> 00:01:14.320
begin with.

23
00:01:14.320 --> 00:01:17.680
So if that's where you're starting at,
then this is the series to watch.

24
00:01:17.680 --> 00:01:18.402
I hope you enjoy.

25
00:01:18.402 --> 00:01:20.358
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne, introduce us to PowerPoint 2016.  They discuss what it is and why we would choose to use it.  They take the time to also show some of the different powerpoint plans users are likely to work with in the workplace.  Vonne and Ronnie also show how to get started working in PowerPoint from scratch!
episodes.title: Introduction to PowerPoint

episodes.description: in this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at the powerpoint environment.  They show how to navigate in the PowerPoint environment and many of the different tools users will access.  Vonne demonstrates how the environment changes and the different ways to customize and use powerpoint tools.  She also demonstrates some of the different elements that show up when looking at the slides pane.  Lastly, she shows how to run the PowerPoint itself.
episodes.title: The PowerPoint Environment

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show us how to work with PowerPoint slides.  They demonstrate some of the utilities in powerpoint to help us to create slides with slide layouts.  Vonne also shows how to change slide layout, order and add sections.  They discuss the use of sections and of pointer options that show up in PowerPoint 2016
episodes.title: Working with Slides

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne showed how to work with text and features that help us work with text in PowerPoint 2016.  Vonne demonstrated the PowerPoint helps when you begin to type text and setup slides.  She demonstrated  how it helps us to autosize and the AutoCorrect features.  Lastlly, the discussed and showed how to change the autocorrect options within PowerPoint.
episodes.title: Working with Text

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne continue working with text in PowerPoint 2016.  They demonstrate some of the different options for getting text into PowerPoint without having to manually type text.  They talk about and show cut, copy and paste options, as well as selecting texts and using find and replace to help Powerpoint users put text where they want it to go!
episodes.title: Working with Text Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at formatting text in PowerPoint 2016.  They differentiate how to apply character formatting and paragraph formatting.  Vonne displays selecting fonts, size and color.   They discuss the use of bullets and colors for the effect that we can create on the powerpoint.  Lastly, they demonstrate that formatting the speaker notes show up in the notes view but not in the normal view.
episodes.title: Formatting Text

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne demonstrate how to use images in PowerPoint.   They show how to insert an image and how to manipulate the image by using the sizing handles and different tools that can change the appearance of the image on a slide.   They discuss the importance of image size and cropping too.  Lastly, Vonne also demonstrates how to remove some background from some images.
episodes.title: Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at using formatting and themes to help make our presentations visually appealing.  Vonne demonstrates how to apply a theme and modify a theme too.  She also demonstrates different elements that can be changed to create our own theme if we choose.  She uses a background color with a theme to show how we can create a custom theme that can be saved and used again later.  Lastly, she shows a new feature, with office 365,  the design ideas that helps you to get started with PointPoint appeal.
episodes.title: Formatting Slides and Themes

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show us how to add, use and modify and format shapes in PowerPoint.  Vonne demonstrates inserts shapes, and shows the tools associated with manipulating and changing these shapes to help us make the impact we need with these shapes.
episodes.title: Shapes

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at using Smart Art in PowerPoint.  Smart Art is a combination of shapes and text and formatting that help to convey the relationship of data we want to present, according to the duo.  They demonstrate how easy it is use it and add them to our presentation.  Vonne demonstrates how to add shapes, delete and modify shapes to make our point.  She demonstrates the use of lists and the hierarchy within the Smart Art to Convey topics as well as organizational order.
episodes.title: SmartArt

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne begin to insert in a table in PowerPoint.  Vonne demonstrates the different parts of a created table and show how they can be manipulated and formatted.  She then show how to create tables and add data as well as change the table, the rows, columns and cells along with formatting to make the table display the way we want for a presentation.
episodes.title: Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne discuss the purpose and creation of charts in Microsoft PowerPoint. Charts allow us to summarize and compare data in graphical representation. Vonne reviews the terminology associated with charts, chart types, how to insert a chart, add data to a chart, add and modify chart elements, as well as format charts for a presentation.
episodes.title: Charts

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike discuss how to add animations to a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate adding basic animations, modifying animations and adding multiple animations. They also look at using motion paths and custom paths with animations. They finish up by demonstrating adding sounds to animations and using animations with SmartArt.
episodes.title: Animation

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike demonstrate working with slide transitions in PowerPoint. They add slide transitions to a single slide and to all slides. They look at the different effect options available for some slide transitions. They also show how to add sounds and modify the duration of slide transitions.
episodes.title: Slide Transitions

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at the final stages of creating a PowerPoint presentation. They go over using spell check and the thesaurus. They discuss printing options, hiding slides, adding headers and footers, and running your presentation. They also explore the different options available for sharing, exporting and saving a PowerPoint presentation.
episodes.title: Preparing a Presentation
